name: YOTEL London Heathrow Airport

reviews.text: Don't be fooled like I was. The Yotel is NOT located inside Terminal 4! You have to exit through immigrations and hunt hard to find it tucked away in an odd location outside the arrivals baggage claim area. It took me over an hour to get there from Terminal 3 and track it down (no one in airport knew where it was and it's not listed on and of terminal 4's maps or information boards). After finally finding it, I had to take a train back to Terminal 1 after my stay because the Yotel is located outside the inter-terminal bus transfer service. The cabin was nice, it was clean, and the bed was very comfortable. But I lost half the sleep time I was counting on (and paid for) just getting there, trying to find it, and then making sure I had time to get back to my terminal and go through security and immigrations once again. And then to top it off, the fire alarm warning system at the hotel malfunctioned and it went off every 20 minutes. Not the rest I had imagined between two 12-hour fights! Maybe if they get their bugs worked out AND I was flying in and out of Terminal 4, I may give it another shot. Otherwise, I'll just go get a day room at the airport Novotel as I have in the past.
reviews.title: not really IN the terminal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a concept! The Yotel at London Heathrow offers a cozy getaway while in transit. We booked the Yotel for our 8 hour layover between a trans-atlantic flight arriving in the morning and an evening flight into Egypt. Online booking was straightforward and the videos of the rooms were accurate.
reviews.title: Far better than the transit lounge benches!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Checkin was quite easy. Simply bring your confirmation number from your online receipt and type it into the check-in area. Your key is ejected, and you are taken to your room, through long and narrow hallways.
reviews.title: just right!

reviews.text: The standard cabin was not as claustrophobic as I feared. There was nice lighting, either bright light or soothing purple light. The bedding was soft and even the single bed had two pillows and a down comforter. The only major issue with layout was the bathroom - the wall was glass, and there was no door. When two people were sharing the room, there was absolutely no privacy for any of the 5 senses. The rainwater shower, on the other hand, was terrific with tons of water pressure and hot water. The soap provided was yummy. There was no bath mat provided, a small problem given the shower shared space with the toilet and sink. However, 2 big bath towels were provided.
reviews.title: Pretty cozy

likes.liked: — Location, price, comfy beds, great shower

reviews.text: The entertainment system was great. There were many television channels, pay movies, free music including some great Arabic chill-out music. However, the remote control was difficult to use and it was hard to find volume control. Also, the internet was difficult to use with the remote control provided. Beware the tv alarm though - it did not work for us - luckily we had another alarm set.
reviews.title: Unique experience, convenient, some room for improvement

reviews.text: Arrived in LHR after 13 hour flight. Had a meeting in centra london the next day and was leaving straight after that. To come off a plane feelng so tired and have no train / taxi to a hotel in London or a bus to a hotel around heathrow was just magical.
reviews.title: Awsome

reviews.text: Check in took a few mins . I thought the standard room wold be claustrphobic but it was fine - plenty of room for my suitcase and coud hang suits etc. Shower was seriously good, 2 big towels, great size bed with lovely white comfy duvet and lots of TV choices. Really clean and so comfortable. Did not hear any noise all night and right opposite the enterance is a Whetherspoons pub serving great food and drink at reasonable prices. You could not ask for me. They should have these at every airport - they are magical. Great shower a few hours sleep and peace and quiet away from the hussle and bussle of the airport - I am sold.
reviews.title: Awesome Layover Choice

likes.liked: — convenience, cleanliness, value for the price
likes.disliked: — slow internet, lack of TV news, noisy cleaners

reviews.text: I arrived at 10:00 at T4 and had to meet someone at T1 at 4:00, so I made a reservation for 11:00 to 3:00. Although I didn't get there until 11:30, it was totally worth the money not to be with the masses for hours!
reviews.title: I will never get an early taxi again

reviews.text: It was great to be able to have a place to myself. Everything was very clean and the bed was comfy. Don't let the pictures fool you, it is small, but there was enough room for my suitcase and me!
reviews.title: Totally Awesome Place!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: Staying at the Yotel is an experience in itself. Directly outside the Yotel is the Arrivals area in Terminal 4 of Heathrow Airport, inside the Yotel is a place of peace and tranquility. The lighting is a cool purple shade, and you check yourself in with terminals that even pop out your room card. The rooms themselves bring a new meaning to "tiny European hotel room", with barely enough room for one person to walk around. They are very new, clean and futuristic looking though. The double room has a double bed (that folds down with the touch of a button), a flat screen TV, small shelving with a table and chair tucked into it, and a full bathroom. All in the size of your closet at home! The single rooms are even smaller, with half of a bunk bed and a bathroom. You literally can't have more than one person standing in them at one time. This being said, the Yotel is perfect for anyone who arrives late at Heathrow or has an early flight. It takes about an hour to get to Heathrow from central london, or about 30 seconds from the Yotel. The Yotel brings sleeping convenience to a new level, and our family agreed that every airport should have one. There's nothing better after a long flight than to be able to walk in a few minutes to your hotel and be sleeping in no time. Even if you have a long connection, you could rent out the Yotel for a couple of hours and take a snooze. It should be noted that the Yotel is in Terminal 4, so if your flight arrives in any other of the terminals you'll have to take a free train that connects the terminals together to get to the Yotel. All in all, we loved the Yotel, and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Very, Very Cool Hotel -- Every Airport Should Have One!

likes.disliked: — The size of the rooms, but it can't really be helped considering it's right in the airport

reviews.text: Stopped here for a few hours to recuperate after a 23hr flight from Australia. Great concept, and allowed me to have a quick shower and freshen up and take a break before my onward journey. Really funky (but extremely cramped) room, but that is the point of the place so it's not a criticism. I wish more airports had this Yotel type facility. Would use again.
reviews.title: Great place for a pit stop

aka: Yotel London Heathrow Airport Hotel Hounslow
description: YOTEL is inside Terminal 4, located moments away from arrivals, departures, Heathrow Express and underground stations. There are two types of cabins - standard (large single) and premium (double) - both equipped with en-suite bathrooms, free WiFi and a flat screen TV entertainment system. Services available include 24-hour food and drink delivered to your cabin in 15 minutes. The best thing - you can book just a few hours or overnight.
